intro: Nototriche turritella, commonly known as the turritella nototriche, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
